verses.name: Matthew 27:1
verses.text: When the morning was come, all the chief priests and elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:

verses.name: Matthew 27:2
verses.text: And when they had bound him, they led him away, and delivered him to Pontius Pilate the governor.

verses.name: Matthew 27:3
verses.text: Then Judas, which had betrayed him, when he saw that he was condemned, repented himself, and brought again the thirty pieces of silver to the chief priests and elders,

verses.name: Matthew 27:4
verses.text: Saying, I have sinned in that I have betrayed the innocent blood. And they said, What is that to us? see thou to that.
